Please post any future questions on our forums.

The right command to install PyTorch with CUDA 8.0 using anaconda is conda install pytorch cuda80 magma-cuda80 -c soumith. If you install from source and CUDA is not found, make sure to set CUDA_HOME env variable to where you installed it.

body:
Please post any future questions on [our forums](discuss.pytorch.org).

The right command to install PyTorch with CUDA 8.0 using anaconda is `conda install pytorch cuda80 magma-cuda80 -c soumith`. If you install from source and CUDA is not found, make sure to set `CUDA_HOME` env variable to where you installed it.
